results.title: The ABC of unions
results.creator_credit: Tasmanian Film Corporation and Barry Pierce
results.brief_description: A group of high school students, reacting against their harsh music master, devise an analogous story about why there are trade unions. They learn all about arbitration, bargaining and compromise. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.
results.description: A group of high school students, reacting against their harsh music master, devise an analogous story about why there are trade unions. They learn all about arbitration, bargaining and compromise. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.

results.title: The ABC of puppets
results.creator_credit: Portia Hawley and Bailey Film Productions
results.brief_description: A film in two parts. Part 1 illustrates the processes of making a glove puppet in detail. Part 2 shows the construction of a stage for the puppets and their manipulation. The story of Hansel and Gretel is performed.

results.title: The ABC of It
results.creator_credit: Brian Adams, ABC-TV (Australia) and Stafford Garner
results.brief_description: An impressionistic look at the many aspects of the Australian Broadcasting Commission, showing film crews on location and in the studio; collation and broadcasting of daily news; events; ethnic radio; orchestral performances; sporting events coverage; and rating surveys.

results.title: The 26 old characters
results.brief_description: Traces the history of the alphabet and writing from the earliest times. Shows some of the early writing instruments up to the development of the fountain pen.

results.title: The 2-D shapes game
results.creator_credit: Stephen Bosustow and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description: A magic drawing board introduces children to the 5 basic 2-dimensional shapes (square, circle, triangle, rectangle and ellipse). The film establishes the characteristics of regular plane shapes and helps children to recognize and name them. Suitable for primary grades.

results.title: The 1954 Redex trial
results.creator_credit: Roland Litchfield, Litchfield Productions and Peter Whitchurch
results.brief_description: A record of the 1954 Redex around Australia reliability car trial. The 9,600 mile route commenced at Sydney and passed through every Australian capital city. Only 124 of the 248 starters finished the 18-day trial. The film captures the atmosphere and illustrates conditions experienced by drivers in the trial as they drove through the rain, extremes of heat and cold, choking dust, across roads which in many places were rarely used bush tracks full of hazards to both car and their weary, strained drivers, who, at the same time had to be careful of secret controls to check their speed. Concluding sequences show arrival, welcome and presentation of the winner.

results.title: The 'Shop steward'
results.creator_credit: Guy Glover, ONF | NFB and Morten Parker
results.brief_description: A dramatized presentation of the role of the shop steward in the effective day-to-day funtioning of free trade unionism. The film beings with the election of machinists Johnny Walachuk as shop steward for the men in his section of a large industrial plant. Continuing, it shows the part the shop steward plays in carrying out the grievance procedures set up by company and union. How Johnny fulfills responsibility to protect from infractions of the agreement the men who elected him, is told in his own words and typifies the function of the union shop stewards generally in Canada.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Guy Glover, ONF | NFB and Morten Parker

results.title: Thatching
results.creator_credit: E. Lawrence Couter, International Film Bureau and Angus MacAskill
results.brief_description: The film details a process important to house-building in England and the early New England colonies. Using authentic tools and techniques, a seasoned worker at the Plimoth Plantation in Massachusetts thatches the roof of a newly constructed cottage. The film covers all steps, which usually takes one man from eight to ten weeks to complete.
